channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024031382
item.description:
Report X-2024031382

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was either handled incorrectly that led to spillage or the package was loaded incorrectly and leaked due to the ignoring of arrow orientation. DescribePack: Loose cap that caused the entire bottle to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Liquid was soaked up using absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2024031226
item.description:
Report X-2024031226

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was not following proper handling of hazardous materials. Package handler attempted to lift the metal pail over his head to place onto the van line when he dropped the pail. As a result, the pail dented causing a puncher hole where liquid was leaking from. Ops Manager on the van line immediately contacted the quality assurance team and the spill was quickly contained. DescribePack: Metal pail has a dent on the side with a small puncher hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The metal pail was quickly placed in a hazmat bag with loose absorb material and placed in a hazardous spill drum and kept in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024030458
item.description:
Report E-2024030458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LAFAYETTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/20/2024, at 0712, personnel in the CSXT Lafayette Yard reported CTCX731986, a loaded tank car of Alcohols, N.O.S. (Denatured Fuel Ethanol), leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper Poet Bioprocessing, was contact via PERS (Report #02787. RMS, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 1 of 6 manway cover bolts less than tool tight. RMS personnel properly secured the manway cover and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Sierra Torr (765-712-1696, sierra.torr@poet.com). The car was released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024030489
item.description:
Report E-2024030489

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight terminal personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete terminal floor and estimated that two (2) cups of material was released due to a damage BIB container. Dayton Freight terminal personnel cleaned the impacted area and placed the cleanup debris into one (1) 10-gallon metal pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024030049
item.description:
Report I-2024030049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LINDE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While transported on drum, on a pallet, with a forklift, the pallet broke, causing the drum to fall onto the ground. Approximately 2.5 gallons of free product were released onto the asphalt surface and an undetermined amount impacted a storm drain. Linde Inc. personnel performed the cleanup using absorbent pads. The waste was placed into drums for disposal.
